ygData.subject: Advice on Cantera linking problem...
ygData.msgSnippet: Hello, I am currently attempting to couple Cantera to a CFD solver. Therefore I need to create a shared library. As a starting point I use the Cantera F77

Subject: Advice on Cantera linking problem...
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=85273841; y=TR1MgomSfmpNwDg2AuvHvUNDjlBdkG8d_uq7-m-Mm7mgCuQu1xG2Rrf8zGA

X-eGroups-Approved-By: dggoodwin <dgoodwin@...> via web; 19 Oct 2005 12:40:12 -0000

Hello,

I am currently attempting to couple Cantera to a CFD solver. Theref=
ore 
I need to create a shared library. As a starting point I use the 
Cant=
era F77 interface that comes with the current stable distribution. 
I am wo=
rking on a x86 Linux system with the g77 and g++ compilers. 
Unfortunately =
I ran into some linker problems, which seem to be 
Cantera related. 

The F=
77 interface and demo compile and run fine on my system (with the 
modifica=
tions posted on this list). 

In the next step I included the content of de=
mo.f as a subroutine into 
a cant.F, which will be called by the CFD solver=
. My makefile then 
does the following:


/usr/bin/g77 -fpic -I/usr/local/s=
hare/3D/include -O3 -g -fno-second-
underscore -o linux-amd64//cant.o -c ca=
nt.F
/usr/bin/g++ -fpic -I/usr/local/share/3D/include -O3 -Wall -I/home/
it=
snas/beck/cantera64/include -v -o linux-amd64//demo_ftnlib.o -c 
demo_ftnli=
b.c
/usr/bin/g77 -shared -L/home/itsnas/beck/SharedLibraries64/linux-amd64 =

-luser -loneD -lzeroD -ltransport -lcantera -lrecipes -lcvode -
lctlapack =
-lctblas -lctmath -ltpx -lg2c -lconverters =96lctcxx -o ./
linux-amd64//lib=
cant.so linux-amd64//cant.o linux-amd64//demo_ftnlib.o

The compiling and l=
inking process run through without an error 
message. If I call the shared =
library from the CFD code a problem 
occurs. 

/home/itsnas/beck/SharedLibr=
aries64/linux-amd64/libcant.so: undefined 
symbol: _ZNSt24__default_alloc_t=
emplateILb1ELi0EE12_S_free_listE

After some grepping I found this string i=
n the standard c++ Library. 
Including -lstdc++ in the linker call solves t=
his problem.


Now a new problem occurs:

/home/itsnas/beck/SharedLibraries=
64/linux-amd64/libcant.so: undefined 
symbol: _ZTVN7Cantera5PhaseE

At this=
 I am out of ideas for solving the problem. If someone can come 
up with ad=
vice I would be most grateful.

regards,
Christian Beck
